sub_title:
Assistant Professor Cardiac Devices, PhD, FESC, FEHRA,
EHRA CCDS at Erasmus MC, teacher Med Delta
summary:
Dominic A, Theuns PhD, is an assistant professor in cardiac devices at the Department of Cardiology, Erasmus Medical Center, Rotterdam (NL). His clinical activities include follow-up and trouble-shooting of CIED patients and is responsible for the medical device outpatient clinic. He is an EHRA certified cardiac device specialist.
For years, my clinical research is focused on risk modeling of mortality in CIED patients, especially patients treated with a CRT-D. Over the years, he developed an international collaboration with Basel University (prof Schaer), Seattle University (prof Levy) and recently with Toronto University (dr Alba). He has (co)authored over 220 original articles in peer-reviewed journals. He published a book on analysis of stored EGMs in ICDs, contributed to several chapters, such as ESC textbook of Cardiology and co-authored the 2nd edition of EHRA book on devices.  He was involved in the development of the subcutaneous ICD since 2005 and validated both the arrhythmia discrimination algorithm as well as the SMART Pass filter of this device.

Dominic graduated in exercise physiology from the University of Maastricht in 1991. He started as an allied professional at the Department of Cardiology, MUMC, Maastricht (NL). He was trained by prof Wellens and Smeets in interpreting ECGs, and developed the cardiac electrophysiology unit at the Department of Cardiology, Erasmus Medical Center, Rotterdam (NL) in 1998 with prof Jordaens. Erasmus MC is an EHRA Recognised Training Centre (ERTC).

Dr. Theuns is a Fellow of the European Society of Cardiology (FESC) and European Heart Rhythm Association (FEHRA). Furthermore, he is an active member of the Netherlands Society of Cardiology (NVVC) and Netherlands Heart Rhythm Association (NHRA). He is a member of the NHRA device advisory committee since 2006 and NVVC ICD task force member since 2021. In addition, he is an active member of the ESC and EHRA. He was associate editor of EP-Europace (2007-2022) and member and co-chair of the EHRA certication committee (2010 - 2022), Recently, he was appointed as ESC task force member in ACNAP and represents EHRA.
